text: Vermont State Board of Education – Department of Education
label: TITLE

text: Vermont State Board of Education Meeting on August 18, 2009: Agenda (Item I-6)
label: BODY

text: State Board of Education
label: HH1

text: August 18, 2009
label: BODY

text: Item I-6
label: BODY

text: DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION
label: HH1

text: Montpelier, Vermont
label: BODY

text: TEAM:
label: HH1

text: Standards and Assessment
label: BODY

text: ITEM:
label: HH1

text: Will the State Board of Education approve the Commissioner’s Required Actions
label: BODY

text: for Schools in Year One Corrective Action:
label: BODY

text: 1. Academy School, Brattleboro
label: BODY

text: 2. Barre Town School
label: BODY

text: 3. Bellows Falls Middle School
label: BODY

text: 4. BFA Fairfax Elementary / Middle School
label: BODY

text: 5. Camel’s Hump Middle School, Richmond
label: BODY

text: 6. Derby Elementary School
label: BODY

text: 7. Duxbury/Waterbury Union Schools (Thatcher Brook Primary School and
label: BODY

text: Crossett Brook Middle School)
label: BODY

text: 8. Highgate Elementary School
label: BODY

text: 9. Lyman Hunt Middle School, Burlington
label: BODY

text: 10. Riverside Middle School, Springfield
label: BODY

text: 11. Springfield High School
label: BODY

text: 12. St. Albans Town Education Center
label: BODY

text: 13. Swanton Schools
label: BODY

text: 14. H. O. Wheeler School, Burlington
label: BODY

text: 15. Williston Schools (Allen Brook School and Williston Central School)
label: BODY

text: 16. Winooski High School
label: BODY

text: STATUTORY AUTHORITY:  16 V.S.A. §165(b)
label: HH1

text: BACKGROUND INFORMATION:
label: HH1

text: For schools that have not made Adequate Yearly Progress (AYP) for four consecutive years, the
label: BODY

text: Commissioner recommends to the State Board of Education either the continuation of technical
label: BODY

text: assistance or one of the other consequences available under 16 V.S.A. §165(b). Schools at this
label: BODY

text: level must choose and implement one action from a list of six actions listed in the No child left
label: BODY

text: Behind Act (NCLBA).
label: BODY

text: COST IMPLICATIONS:
label: HH1

text: A school support coordinator is assigned to each school. Technical assistance is provided and
label: BODY

text: additional funding, as available, is provided to schools in support of the Commissioner’s
label: BODY

text: Required Actions.
label: BODY

text: STAFF AVAILABLE:
label: HH1

text: Gail Taylor, Director of Standards and Assessment; Kathy Blanchard, Pat Johnson, Tina Muncy,
label: BODY

text: and Lisa Lovelette, School Support Coordinators
label: BODY

text: RECOMMENDED ACTION: That the State Board of Education approve the
label: HH1

text: Commissioner’s Required Actions for the Year One Corrective Action schools listed
label: HH1

text: above.
label: HH1

text: Vermont State Board of Education – Department of Education
label: BODY

text: Vermont State Board of Education Meeting on August 18, 2009: Agenda (Item I-6)
label: BODY

text: DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION
label: HH1

text: Montpelier, Vermont
label: BODY

text: Commissioner’s Required Actions
label: HH1

text: Year 1 Corrective Action
label: BODY

text: REGARDING:
label: HH1

text: STATUTORY AUTHORITY:
label: HH1

text: T. 16 section 165:
label: HH1

text: (b) Every year…if the commissioner determines that a school is making insufficient progress in
label: BODY

text: improving student performance in relation to the standards for student performance set forth in
label: BODY

text: subdivision 164(9) of this title, he or she shall describe in writing actions a district must take in
label: BODY

text: order to meet…standards and shall provide technical assistance to the school. If the school fails
label: BODY

text: to meet the standards or make sufficient progress by the end of the next two year period, the
label: BODY

text: commissioner shall recommend to the state board one or more of the following actions:
label: BODY

text: (1) continue technical assistance.
label: BODY

text: (2) adjust supervisory union boundaries or responsibilities of the superintendency.
label: BODY

text: (3) assume administrative control only to the extent necessary to correct deficiencies, or
label: BODY

text: (4) close the school and require that the school district pay tuition to another public
label: BODY

text: school or an approved independent school pursuant to chapter 21 of this title.
label: BODY

text: (c) The state board, after offering the school board an opportunity for a hearing, shall either
label: BODY

text: dismiss the commissioner’s recommendation or order that one or more of the actions listed in
label: BODY

text: subsection (b) or this section be taken. The action ordered by the state board shall be the least
label: BODY

text: intrusive consistent with the need to provide students attending the school substantially equal
label: BODY

text: educational opportunities. A school board aggrieved by an order of the state board may appeal
label: BODY

text: the order in accordance with the Rules of Civil Procedure.
label: BODY

text: REQUIRED ACTIONS
label: HH1

text: Pursuant to this statutory mandate, described below are the actions that the school will
label: HH1

text: take:
label: HH1

text: 1) Corrective Actions
label: HH1

text: All schools must implement one of the following corrective actions:
label: HH1

text: a) Appoint an outside expert to advise the school on its progress toward making
label: HH1

text: adequate yearly progress based on its school plan.
label: BODY

text: b) Institute and fully implement new curriculum, including providing appropriate
label: HH1

text: professional development for all relevant staff, that is based on scientifically-based
label: BODY

text: research and offers substantial promise of improving educational achievement for
label: BODY

text: low-achieving students and enabling the school to make adequate yearly progress.
label: BODY

text: c) Extend the school year or the school day for the school.
label: HH1

text: d) Significantly decrease management authority at the school level.
label: HH1

text: e) Restructure internal organizational structure of the school.
label: HH1

text: f) Replace the school staff who are relevant to the failure to make adequately yearly
label: HH1

text: progress.
label: BODY

text: Vermont State Board of Education – Department of Education
label: BODY

text: Vermont State Board of Education Meeting on August 18, 2009: Agenda (Item I-6)
label: BODY

text: You must provide official written notification to your School Support Coordinator of your
label: HH1

text: choice from the above list by October 1, 2009. Notification must be signed by your school
label: HH1

text: board chair and superintendent.
label: HH1

text: 2) Supplemental Educational Services
label: HH1

text: Title I schools must provide Supplemental Educational Services in accordance with Section
label: BODY

text: 1116 of Title I.
label: BODY

text: 3) Principal Learning Community
label: HH1

text: a) The principal of the school will attend a Principal Learning Community (PLC) made up
label: BODY

text: of other principals in the region on a monthly or bimonthly basis. These PLCs will
label: BODY

text: provide a venue for principals to talk to each other about successful strategies and
label: BODY

text: challenges related to improving student achievement, specifically:
label: BODY

text:  Implementation of the Commissioner’s Required Actions (data development,
label: BODY

text: gathering and analysis, systems of support, etc.)
label: BODY

text:  Addressing achievement gaps (Free and Reduced Lunch, Students with Disabilities)
label: BODY

text: that caused AYP identification
label: BODY

text:  Implementation of federal requirements such as Supplemental Educational Services
label: BODY

text: 4) Aligned Curriculum
label: HH1

text: a. Submit a written curriculum to your School Support Coordinator in reading and
label: BODY

text: mathematics at all grade levels that is aligned to the Grade Expectations. Documents are
label: BODY

text: due no later than June 30, 2010.
label: BODY

text: 5) Progress Monitoring System
label: HH1

text: The school must develop a Progress Monitoring System in reading and math to provide
label: BODY

text: information about student achievement to inform instruction, professional development, and
label: BODY

text: educational support systems.
label: BODY

text: a) The school will use multiple measures (such as common local assessments) to track
label: BODY

text: student progress with a particular focus on the groups and content areas for which the
label: BODY

text: school is identified.
label: BODY

text: b) For schools identified for the Students with Disabilities subgroup, a separate progress
label: BODY

text: monitoring chart indicating progress on IEP goals will be completed and submitted to
label: BODY

text: your School Support Coordinator by February 15, and July 1, 2010.
label: BODY

text: c) Grade level or department teams will collect and analyze the data from these measures at
label: BODY

text: least at mid-marking period and at the end of each marking period. Your School Support
label: BODY

text: Coordinator will meet with your leadership team in fall 2009 to discuss and help set up
label: BODY

text: the framework for this system.
label: BODY

text: d) As a result of the analysis of the data, grade level or department teams will take the
label: BODY

text: following actions to address the issues presented in the data:
label: BODY

text:  Identify and provide specific academic supports needed for all students who perform
label: BODY

text: below expectations.
label: BODY

text:  Refer all students who meet established criteria to the appropriate services and
label: BODY

text: supports.
label: BODY

text: Vermont State Board of Education – Department of Education
label: BODY

text: Vermont State Board of Education Meeting on August 18, 2009: Agenda (Item I-6)
label: BODY

text:  Monitor student participation in those supports and their effects on student outcomes.
label: BODY

text:  Provide evidence of discussions, plans and/or specific steps taken to address needs
label: BODY

text: related to instruction and professional development identified by the data.
label: BODY

text: e) The principal will hold all grade level or department teams responsible for completing the
label: BODY

text: actions listed above and provide reflective feedback.
label: BODY

text: f) The Progress Monitoring System will continue to be developed as part of the
label: BODY

text: Comprehensive Local Assessment System.
label: BODY

text: 6) Local and State Reports
label: HH1

text: a. Each grade level or department team will provide a written report and updated data charts
label: BODY

text: to their principal who will submit them to the School Support Coordinator on February
label: BODY

text: 15, 2010 and on July 1, 2010. A summary report will be presented to the local school
label: BODY

text: board prior to that submission. Mid-year and end-of-year reports will contain updated
label: BODY

text: data charts and a narrative with the following information:
label: BODY

text: 1. What common assessments do you use as a grade level or team to make ongoing
label: BODY

text: instructional decisions?
label: BODY

text: 2. How often does your team review data from the assessments?
label: BODY

text: 3. What process does your team use to analyze the data?
label: BODY

text: 4. What actions did your team make as a result of the data analysis for students not
label: BODY

text: meeting expectations?
label: BODY

text: 5. What supports are available for students at your grade level during the school day and
label: BODY

text: after school?
label: BODY

text: 6. After reviewing student participation in all available supports, identify students not
label: BODY

text: receiving consistent supports. Share why they did not receive support and what your
label: BODY

text: team will do to ensure support in the future.
label: BODY

text: 7. What are the primary concerns related to student data in the areas of math and
label: BODY

text: literacy? Identify your team’s most pressing concern in math and most pressing
label: BODY

text: concern in literacy. The concerns must be based on data and something over which
label: BODY

text: your team has control.
label: BODY

text: 8. Considering the two areas of concern identified above, what are all the possible
label: BODY

text: explanations regarding what your team is
label: BODY

text: doing or not doing that might contribute to the concerns?
label: BODY

text: b. Schools identified for the students with disabilities subgroup will submit mid-year and
label: BODY

text: end-of-year reports which include data charts with criteria specified by your School
label: BODY

text: Support Coordinator and a narrative with the following information:
label: BODY

text:  A description of how frequently the data were reviewed and by whom
label: BODY

text:  A description of the process the school used to analyze the data
label: BODY

text:  The plans or actions taken as a result of the analysis to include steps related to
label: BODY

text: instruction, professional development and student supports
label: BODY

text:  What are the primary concerns related to student data? Identify your team’s two most
label: BODY

text: pressing concerns. The concerns must be based on data and something over which
label: BODY

text: your team has control.
label: BODY

text:  Considering the two areas of concern identified above, what are all the possible
label: BODY

text: explanations regarding what your team is doing or not doing that might contribute to
label: BODY

text: the concerns?
label: BODY

text: Vermont State Board of Education – Department of Education
label: BODY

text: Vermont State Board of Education Meeting on August 18, 2009: Agenda (Item I-6)
label: BODY

text: Public reports must not include student names or any personally identifiable
label: BODY

text: information. Please delete student names from all reports sent to your School
label: BODY

text: Support Coordinator.
label: BODY

text: 7) Meetings with Tech Centers
label: HH1

text: All identified high schools must participate in regularly scheduled coordination meetings with
label: BODY

text: the administrators from other high schools and the tech center in their region. The high school
label: BODY

text: will provide evidence/minutes of those meetings to the School Support Coordinator by January
label: BODY

text: The above actions meet the requirements of V.S.A. Title 16 section of 165 (b).
label: HH1

text: Signatures:
label: HH1

text: Commissioner
label: BODY

text: Date
label: BODY

text: I have read and understand the required actions listed above.

text: Will the State Board of Education approve the Commissioner’s Required Actions
label: BODY

text: for Schools in Year Two Corrective Action:

text: Burlington High School
label: BODY

text: Otter Valley Union High School, Brandon
label: BODY

text: Molly Stark School, Bennington
label: BODY

text: Rutland Middle School

text: STATUTORY AUTHORITY:  16 V.S.A. §165(b)
label: HH1

text: BACKGROUND INFORMATION:
label: HH1

text: For schools that have not made Adequate Yearly Progress (AYP) for five consecutive years, the
label: BODY

text: Commissioner recommends to the State Board of Education either the continuation of technical
label: BODY

text: assistance or one of the other consequences available under 16 V.S.A. §165(b). Schools at this
label: BODY

text: level are required to develop Restructuring Plans to be implemented during the 2010-11 school
label: BODY

text: year.
label: BODY

text: COST IMPLICATIONS:
label: HH1

text: A school support coordinator is assigned to each school. Technical assistance is provided and
label: BODY

text: additional funding, as available, is provided to schools in support of the Commissioner’s
label: BODY

text: Required Actions.
label: BODY

text: STAFF AVAILABLE:
label: HH1

text: Gail Taylor, Director of Standards and Assessment; Kathy Blanchard, Pat Johnson, Tina Muncy,
label: BODY

text: and Lisa Lovelette, School Support Coordinators
label: BODY

text: RECOMMENDED ACTION: That the State Board of Education approve the
label: HH1

text: Commissioner’s Required Actions for the Year Two Corrective Action schools listed
label: HH1

text: DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION

text: Montpelier, Vermont

text: Commissioner’s Required Actions
label: HH1

text: Year 2 Corrective Action
label: BODY

text: REGARDING:
label: HH1

text: STATUTORY AUTHORITY:
label: HH1

text: T. 16 section 165
label: HH1

text: (b) Every year…if the commissioner determines that a school is making insufficient progress in
label: BODY

text: improving student performance in relation to the standards for student performance set forth in
label: BODY

text: subdivision 164(9) of this title, he or she shall describe in writing actions a district must take in
label: BODY

text: order to meet…standards and shall provide technical assistance to the school. If the school fails
label: BODY

text: to meet the standards or make sufficient progress by the end of the next two year period, the
label: BODY

text: commissioner shall recommend to the state board one or more of the following actions:
label: BODY

text: (1) continue technical assistance.
label: BODY

text: (2) adjust supervisory union boundaries or responsibilities of the superintendency.
label: BODY

text: (3) assume administrative control only to the extent necessary to correct deficiencies, or
label: BODY

text: (4) close the school and require that the school district pay tuition to another public
label: BODY

text: school or an approved independent school pursuant to chapter 21 of this title.
label: BODY

text: (c) The state board, after offering the school board an opportunity for a hearing, shall either
label: BODY

text: dismiss the commissioner’s recommendation or order that one or more of the actions listed in
label: BODY

text: subsection (b) or this section be taken. The action ordered by the state board shall be the least
label: BODY

text: intrusive consistent with the need to provide students attending the school substantially equal
label: BODY

text: educational opportunities. A school board aggrieved by an order of the state board may appeal
label: BODY

text: the order in accordance with the Rules of Civil Procedure.
label: BODY

text: REQUIRED ACTIONS
label: HH1

text: Pursuant to this statutory mandate, described below are the actions that the school will
label: HH1

text: take:
label: HH1

text: 1) Restructuring
label: HH1

text: The school will develop a Restructuring Plan which will take the place of the School
label: HH1

text: Improvement/Action Plan and take all necessary steps to ensure full implementation of
label: HH1

text: the plan in SY 2010-2011. This plan must result in significant changes in the school’s
label: HH1

text: structure and systems necessary to ensure that students in any group not making AYP
label: HH1

text: have the necessary resources and supports to accelerate their achievement. The plan
label: HH1

text: must also ensure necessary changes in scheduling and provide for any additional
label: HH1

text: supports needed for all teachers to participate in Teacher Learning Communities
label: HH1

text: a. To facilitate completion of the work indicated below, schools must participate in a
label: HH1

text: data analysis and planning retreat staffed by the Department of Education. Each
label: BODY

text: school will send a data team that includes the principal to one day in September and
label: BODY

text: one day in November, 2009.
label: BODY

text: Vermont State Board of Education Meeting on August 18, 2009: Agenda (Item I-6)
label: BODY

text: Vermont State Board of Education – Department of Education
label: BODY

text: b. School and district leadership must evaluate the effectiveness of efforts to improve
label: HH1

text: student achievement for those student groups continuing to not meet AYP. This
label: BODY

text: evaluation should cover the period of time since the school did not make AYP for
label: BODY

text: the first time. The review must cover all critical components of the school’s system
label: BODY

text: (i.e. professional development, local assessment, curriculum and instruction,
label: BODY

text: educational support, supervision and evaluation, school staffing and governance.)
label: BODY

text: c. Building and central office administration must review the allocation and use of all
label: HH1

text: funds including federal, state, and local funds.
label: BODY

text: d. Based on this evaluation of all relevant data, past actions and use of resources, the
label: HH1

text: school’s School Improvement/Action Plan must be updated according to the
label: BODY

text: requirements of §165 (a) (1). The revised plan (the Restructuring Plan) to be
label: BODY

text: implemented no later than SY 2010-2011 must ensure that students in any group not
label: BODY

text: making AYP have the necessary resources and supports to accelerate their
label: BODY

text: achievement.
label: BODY

text: e. A draft report of the plan is due to your School Support Coordinator on February
label: HH1

text: 15, 2010. The final Restructuring Plan that reflects staff and budgeting
label: BODY

text: considerations must be submitted to the School Support Coordinator no later than
label: BODY

text: April 1, 2010.
label: BODY

text: f. High schools must include representation from their regional  Technical Center in
label: HH1

text: the review and update of the Restructuring Plan
label: BODY

text: 2) Teacher Learning Communities (TLC)
label: HH1

text: a) Teacher Learning Communities will be included as part of the Restructuring Plan
label: HH1

text: with the goal to include all teaching staff by the 2010-11 school year.
label: BODY

text: b) Time will be included in the teacher-contracted school day once a month for these
label: HH1

text: TLCs to meet for at least an hour.
label: BODY

text: c) All TLCs will be led by staff who have had Formative Assessment Project (FAP) or
label: HH1

text: Critical Friends Training in facilitation. The principal will attend 2 days of the
label: BODY

text: training.
label: BODY

text: d) The School Support Coordinator will be informed by March 1, 2010 which model
label: HH1

text: the school has selected and what the confirmed training dates are.
label: BODY

text: e) The TLCs will review and analyze student performance data, student work, and
label: HH1

text: teaching strategies.
label: BODY

text: f) The school must initiate at least one TLC as a pilot by January 1, 2010.
label: HH1

text: 3) Supplemental Educational Services
label: HH1

text: Title I schools must provide Supplemental Educational Services in accordance with Section
label: BODY

text: 1116 of Title I.
label: BODY

text: 4) Principal Learning Community
label: HH1

text: The principal of the school will attend a Principal Learning Community (PLC) made up of
label: BODY

text: other principals in the region on a monthly or bimonthly basis. These PLCs will provide a
label: BODY

text: venue for principals to talk to each other about successful strategies and challenges related to
label: BODY

text: improving student achievement, specifically:
label: BODY

text:  Implementation of the Commissioner’s Required Actions (data development, gathering
label: BODY

text: and analysis, systems of support, etc.)
label: BODY

text: Vermont State Board of Education Meeting on August 18, 2009: Agenda (Item I-6)
label: BODY

text: Vermont State Board of Education – Department of Education
label: BODY

text:  Addressing achievement gaps (Free and Reduced Lunch, Students with Disabilities) that
label: BODY

text: caused AYP identification
label: BODY

text:  Implementation of federal requirements such as Supplemental Educational Services
label: BODY

text: 5) Aligned Curriculum
label: HH1

text: Submit a written curriculum to your School Support Coordinator in reading and mathematics
label: BODY

text: at all grade levels that is aligned to the Grade Expectations. Documents are due no later than
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: information about student achievement to inform instruction, professional development, and

text: educational support systems.
label: BODY

text: a. The school will use multiple measures (such as common local assessments) to track
label: BODY

text: school is identified.
label: BODY

text: b.  For schools identified for the Students with Disabilities subgroup, a separate progress
label: BODY

text: monitoring chart indicating progress on IEP goals will be completed and submitted to

text: your School Support Coordinator by February 15, and July 1, 2010.

text: c. Grade level or department teams will collect and analyze the data from these measures at
label: BODY

text: least at mid marking period and at the end of each marking period. Your School Support
label: BODY

text: Coordinator will meet with your leadership team in fall 2009 to discuss and help set up
label: BODY

text: the framework for this system.
label: BODY

text: d. As a result of the analysis of the data, grade level or department teams will take the
label: BODY

text: following actions to address the issues presented in the data:
label: BODY

text:  Identify and provide specific academic supports needed for all students who perform
label: BODY

text: below expectations.
label: BODY

text:  Refer all students who meet established criteria to the appropriate services and
label: BODY

label: BODY

label: BODY

text:  Provide evidence of discussions, plans and/or specific steps taken to address needs
label: BODY

text: related to instruction and professional development identified by the data.
label: BODY

text: e. The principal will hold all grade level or department teams responsible for completing the
label: BODY

text: actions listed above and provide reflective feedback.
label: BODY

text: f. The Progress Monitoring System will continue to be developed as part of the

text: Comprehensive Local Assessment System.

text: a. Each grade level or department team will provide a written report and updated data charts

text: 1. What common assessments do you use as a grade level or team to make ongoing
